page.title: 10Kempley Church
page.content: Kempley church was built in 1100 and is of Norman design with a beautiful Norman arch over the doorway. It is built of stone from the Forest of Dean and has very thick walls. Inside the church there are drawings on the walls called Frescoes which are very famous. They were painted in the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries and show the twelve apostles. The church has got some stained glass windows but quite a lot are clear. It is a very pretty church surrounded by a small graveyard.In the Spring the fields around the church are filled with wild daffodils which people come from far and near to see. Kempley church doesn't have a vicar of its own but shares one with three other churches. There is a service every Sunday.
